intro: Ricinus communis var. lividus, commonly known as the purple castor oil plant, is a variant of the castor oil plant characterized by its striking purple foliage. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. The leaves are typically large, palmately lobed, and have a velvety texture. It produces distinctive yellow flowers that are clustered in spikelike inflorescences. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
